contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} {{Taxobox | name = Panga | image = Pterogymnus laniarius.png | image_width = 250px | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Actinopterygii]] | ordo = [[Perciformes]] | familia = [[Sparidae]] | genus = '''''Pterogymnus''''' | genus_authority = Smith, 1938 | species = '''''P. laniarius''''' | binomial = ''Pterogymnus laniarius'' | binomial_authority = ([[Achille Valeccnciennes|Valenciennes]], 1830) }} '''Panga''' is the common [[South Africa]]n name for '''''Pterogymnus laniarius''''', a small, [[wiktionary:oceanodromous|ocean-dwelling]] [[fish]], native to the southeast [[Atlantic Ocean]] and southwest [[Indian Ocean]]. Alternatively called "torpedo [[Decapterus|scads]]", they are [[Poikilotherm|cold-blooded]] with white flesh. Their scales are generally pink in color with whitish underbelly and blue-green stripes running laterally along their sides. Over the course of its life, a panga will undergo periodic sex-changes with as much as 30% of the population being [[hermaphrodite|hermaphroditic]] at a time. Despite the presence of both sex organs, it is thought unlikely that both are simultaneously active. Panga are slow to reach sexual maturity, with a minimum population doubling time of 4.5â€“14 years. In other countries, the name ''panga'' may refer to a different species. In [[Indonesia]], it refers to ''[[Megalaspis cordyla]]'', in [[Spain]], the [[Netherlands]] and [[Poland]] it refers to ''[[Pangasius hypophthalmus]]'', and in [[Kenya]] it refers to ''[[Trichiurus lepturus]]''. ==References== * {{ITIS |id=647974 |taxon=Pterogymnus laniarius |accessdate=19 March 2006}} * {{FishBase_species|genus=Pterogymnus|species=laniarius|year=2005|month=November}} ==External links== * [http://www.fao.org:80/fi/website/FIRetrieveAction.do?dom=species&fid=3123 FAO's Species Fact Sheet about ''Megalaspis cordyla''] [[Category:Sparidae]] [[Category:Fish of Bangladesh]]
